page.title: 14TUNLEY VILLAGE
page.content: Tunley consists mainly of established people and few young families actually move into Tunley. Most young adults move from Tunley as soon as they are able. 90% of the working population are employed in Bath or at Purnells printing in the neighbouring village of Paulton. Most of the houses are privately owned semi-detatched built after 1945. There is one terrace of council owned houses and a few old mining cottages including one named "Colliery Cottage". One bus service passes through Tunley once every two hours on route between Paulton and Bath . The last bus returns to Tunley at 1900 hours. Tunley village has its own amateur football club but most of the team live in the surrounding villages.
